review_title: A fantastic organisation to work for
pros:
1) Varied work role
2) Work life balance
3) Lots of EDI work
would definitely recommend. positive, friendly working environment and good benefits

review_title: Worth it if you can spare the time
job_title: Part-time Exam Invigilator in Sheffield, England
pros: Wide range of people to meet, good pay
cons: Technical issues, very limited training, only twice a year, repetitive, inconsistent hours

job_title: Deputy Programmer Manager in London, England
pros: Autonomy, seeing how your work makes a difference to services, subsidised canteen, great colleagues and location.
cons: Too much politics and lack of support for staff who work in challenging environments.

pros:
Great culture with lots of staff engagement and focus on wellbeing.

Refurbishing the offices currently which will reflect new and innovative ways of working. 

On site cafe and good local amenities.
cons: Busy and heavy workload and long hours. Managers sometimes too busy to support their staff.

pros: Get a lot of time off (any extra hours you work get added to flexi time which you can use for paid days off)
cons: No progression in your job role at all

pros: Really great team and engaged management. Always felt very valued as a staff member. Good salary and perks.
cons: Staff turnover can be a problem

job_title: Temp Project Coordinator in London, England
pros: Not a micro-managed role, helpful team.

job_title: Head of External Affairs in London, England
pros: It's a great team and its values-driven
Flexible, encouraging, good progression, progressive, forward thinking
cons: Office was freezing cold or really warm

pros: Subsidised lunches. Flexi-time. Strong HR support. Nice people to work with generally. Good culture of support of career goals and training provided.
cons: Senior management is very top down, make decisions without consultation and the people who are affected just have to make it work somehow. Interdepartmental communication is not great. Still in 'austerity', so no pay raises or benefits for a while.

review_title: Pleasant environment and culture; supportive colleagues; good work-life balance
pros:
Flexi policy and extra college closure days after bank holidays/over Christmas - good work life balance
Nice office environment, pleasant, clean, modern, good facilities for staff
Friendly people, excellent support from managers
Nice culture of celebrating successes, and feeling part of a wider organisation e.g. with regular staff briefings from CEO
Lives up to its values
Working with service users/carers
Good support for staff during lockdown/WFH
cons: Lots of admin involved in Project Officer role

review_title: Good stepping stone into mental health
job_title: Head of Accreditation in London, England
pros:
Great colleagues.
Working with former mental health service users and carers an amazing opportunity.
Good variety of work. Great experience for future career in mental health.
Working groups for LBGTQ+, Sex & Gender Equality, Wellbeing at Work, etc.
Brilliant subsidised cafe on-site + nice staff parties.
cons:
Stress levels can be high.
Lots of staff vacancies due to staff leaving and slow HR processes.
HR quite rigid and not always very personable.
Old-fashioned organisation current being brought into 21st Century.

job_title: Internal Communications Officer in London, England
pros: The people there are so passionate about what they do. I felt I was listened to and my ideas were taken seriously. I had the feedom to develop my role and see through ideas.
cons: Travelling to central London could be an issue. The organisation was going through a period of change which was quite stressful at times.

pros:
Flexitime
Generally nice people
Some positive changes were being made by the CEO
cons:
Surprisingly, mental health support for employees was non- existant
Office can feel cold and impersonal

review_title: Great flexitime and support from seniors
pros: Flexi time, good social clubs, good work life balance
cons: Lack of career progression and training opportunities

pros: Great working environment. Flexible working hours.
cons: Not a lot of progression opportunities

pros:
Flexible hours
Discounted cafe
Gateway in mental health career
cons:
Racist management, 
My team enjoyed going to the pub, which I did not
Personal questions was asked concerning my personal life and health
